turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: ... it connects you to me...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: No matter what happens... you're innocent... I promise...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: In the woods you said you had nothing. But you wouldn't, and I wouldn't if there's some way you don't have to go. Please. At least not right away.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Erin. I'll always be with you.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I thought we had an understanding. I thought we understood that discretion is paramount.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Yeah, we do.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Erlich gimping around in his goddamn hot rod is not discreet. I've got reporters asking me how much he made. I've got the entire force looking at this case now.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You know.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: I know the guy leaves a sign.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Tommy Leonard. The eyewitness in the Corvis case.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Some hooker phoned it in. There was a riot at his apartment yesterday.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Guy dressed for Halloween?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Good for you. You do know something.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: They botched the execution.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Could say that.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Christ. It was Corvis. Tommy Leonard was right.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Fucking crow.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Sign of the dead come back to life.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: How about sign of a big black bird?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: The dead can return, given sufficient motivation. And Corvis has that.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Cause if you're losing your mind, I got a right to know.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: He's looking for something. Won't stop until he finds it.  Sometimes the best way to get rid of someone is to let them have what they want.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Just don't believe everything you see.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: Doubt is a motherfucker.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Give me a hand with this sack of shit.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Maybe we had a case of that here.  Get me my kit.

turns.speaker: MADDEN
turns.text: You two are majorly demented. Anyone ever tell you that?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Do you believe in ghosts, Nathan? Because there's a ghost threatening us.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: You mean Alex.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I mean Lauren.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Because you never accepted that what happened to her was an accident.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: You killed my daughter.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: An accident, Nathan.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: She was eighteen years old! There were four of them. They stabbed her fifty three times! Where's the fucking accident?! Huh?! Where is it?!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I watched her grow up. Just like you. I know how her mind worked. She kept snooping around because she was worried about you. What you'd gotten yourself into. So stop blaming me. And blame yourself.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: I do. Every day.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Erin knows, doesn't she?

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: Anything wrong?

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: Let's hope not. License and registration please.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: What's with your friend there?

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: She's... sick.  Actually she never had Mai Tais before.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: But you, you've had them.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: Not tonight. Honest.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: If you had a license, I bet I'd have seen it by now. How old are you? Fifteen?

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: Look, I'll tell you the truth. Jannie drove us and was supposed to drive us back, she has a license, but I mean... look at her.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: You want me to walk a straight line?

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: I want you... to bend over.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: Look, can I just call a cab?

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: What did I say?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Why are there so many?

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Just hold on to me.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I want to take this to Lauren. She'd want it.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Honey. I just can't.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Stay in the car. I'll only take a second.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Erin. I know you think she's been talking to you.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: It's not that. Really. It's just... now that he's gone, I think it's time.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Erin!

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Watch out!

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: What were you yelling about?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: This guy said he was a friend of Lauren's. He had like paint all over his face.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Are you ok?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean? He was right here. He was!

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: The cop who found the knife in Corvis's car.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: What? What is it?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Lauren called me that when we were little. Daisy. No one knew but us.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Honey. It's doesn't mean anything. It's not a message.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: That guy in the cemetery today said he knew everything about Lauren.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: It still doesn't mean...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: He said he'd prove it.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I think I dropped an earring.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Looks like you have them both on.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You're in with them.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: It's not what you think.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You killed her!

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Stay away from me! Stay away!

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Erin. It wasn't supposed to happen.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: They killed her because she found out.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: About you.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: About them. You've got to leave it alone.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Sweetheart...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Don't call me that! Don't call me anything!

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: I would never hurt you or Lauren. Never. Believe me.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: RANDALL
turns.text: Please. Come inside.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I'm never going back in that house again. Get away.

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: You should see it, Professor Barnhardt! You should go out and see it for yourself!

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Thanks -- I'm enjoying it right here.

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: The whole city has stopped. People are running around like ants!

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: What a brilliant idea. I never would have thought of it.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: What about the people who are coming to the meeting tonight? Have they all arrived?

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: I talked to most of them this morning... They were all very curious about the meeting.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Good. Did you speak to our friend Mr. Carpenter?

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: He'll be there at 8:30.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Tell me, Hilda -- does all this frighten you -- does it make you feel insecure?

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: Yes, sir -- it certainly does!

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: That's good, Hilda. I'm glad.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: You wrote this?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It was a clumsy way to introduce myself -- but I understand you're a difficult man to see.  I thought you'd have the solution by this time.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Not yet. That's why I wanted to see you.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Yes -- that will reproduce the first- order terms. But what about the effect of the other terms?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Almost negligible... With variation of parameters, this is the answer.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: How can you be so sure? Have you tested this theory?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I find it works well enough to get me from one planet to another.  I understand you've called a meeting to study our space ship.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: As though unsure of what he's heard) Yes -- yes, I have.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: My name is Klaatu.  I spent two days at your Walter Reed Hospital. Room 309. My doctor's name was Major White -- and I had a very attractive nurse called Ruth, who's getting married next Wednesday.  If you are not interested -- or if you intend to turn me over to your Army -- we needn't waste any more time.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: You have faith, Professor Barnhardt

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: It isn't faith that makes good science, Mr. Klaatu. Its curiosity.  Sit down, please. I have several thousand questions to ask you.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I would like to explain something of my mission here.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: That was my first question.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It was my intention to discuss this officially -- with all the nations of the Earth -- but I was not allowed the Opportunity. I have come to realize since that your mutual fears and suspicions are merely the normal reactions of a primitive society.  We know from scientific observation that you have discovered a rudimentary kind of atomic energy. We also know that you are experimenting with rockets.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Yes -- that is true.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: In the hands of a mature civilization, these would not be considered weapons of aggression. But in the hands of your people--  We've observed your aggressive tendencies, and we don't trust you with such power.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: If you mean that you are afraid of us--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We want to be sure you don't make -- let us say -- an unfortunate mistake. We know the potentiality of these developments and we are disturbed to find them in the hands of children... You see, we've had atomic energy for five thousand of your years.  We discarded instruments like this many centuries ago.  So long as you were limited to fighting among yourselves -- with your primitive tanks and planes -- we were unconcerned. But soon you will apply atomic energy to space ships -- and then you become a threat to the peace and security of other planets. That, of course, we cannot tolerate.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: These other planets -- do they have peace and security?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We had our atomic wars -- thousands of years ago.  After that we fought with bows and arrows. Then, slowly, we learned that fighting is no solution -- that aggression leads to chaos.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: We scientists understand this. Even we primitive scientists.  What exactly is the nature of your mission, Mr. Klaatu?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I came here to warn you that, by threatening danger, your planet faces danger -- very grave danger. I am prepared, however, to offer a solution.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Would you care to be more specific?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: What I have to say must be said to all concerned.  It is too important to be entrusted to any individual.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: I gather that your efforts on the official level were not entirely successful.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I come to you as a last resort -- and I confess that my patience is wearing thin.  Must I take drastic action in order to get a hearing?

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: What -- what sort of action do you mean?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Violent action -- since that seems to be the only thing you people understand.  Leveling the island of Manhattan, perhaps -- or dropping the Rock of Gibraltar into the sea.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Would you be willing to meet with the group of scientists I am calling together?. Perhaps you could explain your mission to them, and they in turn could present it to their various peoples.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: That's what I came to see you about.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: It is not enough to have men of science. We scientists are too easily ignored -- or misunderstood. We must get important men from every field. Educators -- philosophers -- church leaders -- men of vision and imagination -- the finest minds in the world.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I leave that in your hands.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: You'd have no objection to revealing yourself at this meeting?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- not at all.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: What about your personal safety in the meantime? What about the Army -- and the police?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: My name is Carpenter and I'm a very earthy character living in a respectable boarding house.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't offer you any real protection. I have no influence in cases of inter-planetary conspiracy.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm sure I'll be quite safe until the meeting.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: One thing, Mr. Klaatu. Suppose this group should reject your proposals. What is the alternative?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm afraid you have no alternative. In such, a case the planet Earth would have to be--  --eliminated.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Such power exists?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I assure you such power exists.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: The people who came to the meeting must be made to realize this. They must understand what is at stake.  You mentioned a demonstration of force--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Would such, a demonstration be possible before the meeting?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Yes -- of course.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Something that would dramatize for them and for their people the seriousness of the situation. Something that would affect the entire planet.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: That can easily be arranged.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: I wouldn't want you to harm anybody -- or destroy anything.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Why don't you leave it to me? I'll think of something.

turns.speaker: BARNHARDT
turns.text: Maybe a little demonstration.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Something dramatic -- but not destructive.  It's quite an interesting problem.  Would day after tomorrow be all right? Say about noon?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bet he is, Mom. Bet he's out looking for that space man.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I think we've all been hearing too much about "space men."

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Can I help you look for the space man? Can I?  I know what he looks like! He's got a square head -- and, three great big eyes!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's enough, Bobby. I think it's time you went to bed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi Mom!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Hello, darling.  Good evening, Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Did you have a nice day, dear?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Boy, we had a swell time. Didn't we, Mr. Carpenter?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Come on, Bobby. Time to go to bed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mom -- why does Mr. Carpenter have to go down to the police station?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I -- I don't know, dear... Perhaps there's some mistake.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We sure had fun today. We saw the space ship and we went to see Professor Barnhardt -- and--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Professor Barnhardt.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, sure. Mom, do I have to go to school tomorrow?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Of course, dear.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Aw, gee, Mom -- I had plans to play with Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Go to bed, darling. You can finish that in the morning.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Bobby -- I think it would be better if we didn't see quite so much of Mr. Carpenter

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee, why, Mom? He's my best friend... And he's awful good in arithmetic. He even helps Professor Barnhardt.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Did you and Mr. Carpenter really go to see Professor Barnhardt?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure we did! He wasn't there but we went to see him. And Mr. Carpenter showed him how to do his arithmetic.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mom -- is there something wrong with Mr. Carpenter?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What do you mean, dear?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I mean -- on account of that policeman last night.  You think he's a bank robber, maybe? Or a gangster?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, dear, of course not. He's a very nice man. I Just think he might prefer to be left alone. Now you get to bed and forget about it.  'Night, darling.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Bobby--! What are you doing up at this hour?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I couldn't go to sleep, Mom. I had to tell you!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tell me what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I followed Mr. Carpenter -- right after you left -- and, gee, Mom, where do you think he went? Right into the space ship!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Now, Bobby, just a minute--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Honest, Mom, I saw him. It just opened up and he walked right in. And that great big iron man was moving around!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Bobby, you've been dreaming again.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I haven't, Mom. I promise you... I saw it!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Now think back hard. You didn't follow Mr. Carpenter at all, did you? You haven't even been out of the house.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes, I have!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You didn't really see the space ship. You just thought you did.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He gave these to you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, not exactly. I gave him two dollars.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee, Mom, do you think maybe he's a diamond smuggler?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Come on, darling -- we're going up to bed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, boy -- can I, Mom?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes, dear. Come on now.  Bobby, your shoes are soaking!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah -- the grass was kind of wet.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Are you an FBI man?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- I'm afraid not.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Bobby -- who's the greatest man in America today?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee -- I don't know... The space man, I guess.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I was speaking of earth men. I meant the greatest philosopher -- the greatest thinker.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well -- Professor Barnhardt, I guess. He's the greatest scientist in the world.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: He lives here in Washington, doesn't he?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure. Right near where my mother works.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Where is that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Department of Commerce. She's a secretary.  They have a man they call the Secretary, but he isn't at all. My mother's a real secretary.  Mr. Carpenter -- now can we go see the space ship?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Boy, I'll bet he's strong. I bet he could knock down a whole building.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I shouldn't be at all surprised.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee, I'd like to get inside and see how it works. What do you think makes it go?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Well -- atomic power, I would imagine.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I thought that was only for bombs.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No. It's for a lot of other things, too.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You think it can go faster than an F- 36?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Yes -- I think so.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Maybe four thousand miles an hour. And outside the Earth's atmosphere a good deal faster.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee! How could they make a landing?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Well -- there are several ways to reduce landing speed. You see, the velocity--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You think they'll ever find him?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I don't know, Bobby. I'm inclined to doubt it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mr. Carpenter -- what does velocity mean?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Velocity is the time rate of change of position.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Bobby -- I have an idea. Let's go see Professor Barnhardt and find out how he talks.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're just kidding, aren't you?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Wouldn't you like to meet him?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, sure I would, but --  Aw, I'll bet you'd be scared.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We can scare him more than he can scare us.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It's a problem in celestial mechanics.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bet he's the only one in the world knows the answer.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: He doesn't know the answer. And he'll never get it that way.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Did all these people die in wars?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure. Didn't you ever hear of Arlington Cemetery?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- I'm afraid not.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mr. Carpenter" -- you don't seem to know about anything.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'll tell you, Bobby -- I've been away for a long time. Very far away.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Is it different where you've been?  Don't they have places like this?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: They have cemeteries. But not like this one... You see, they don't have any wars.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Go to the movies.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No foolin'? Will you?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Certainly.  Tell me, Bobby -- do you have to have money to go there?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I've got some money. My mother gave me two dollars.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- I want to take you to the movies.  Do you think they'd accept these?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Gee -- those look like diamonds!

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Some places that's what people use for money. They're easy to carry -- and they don't wear out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bet they're worth about a million dollars.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Would you give me your two dollars for a couple of them?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, sure, but--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let's not say anything to my mother about this, Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Why not, Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She doesn't like me to steal from people.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Mrs. Benson -- this is Mr. Brady.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mr. Brady's a cop.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We certainly did.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We went to the movies -- and we had ice cream cones -- and we went to see Daddy--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Aw, gee -- we didn't finish our story.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We'll finish it tomorrow... Goodnight, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: All you have to remember is, first find the common denominator -- then subtract.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thanks, Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'll say goodnight again.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Bobby -- have you a flashlight?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah -- sure.  It's a real Boy Scout flashlight.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you want it for, Mr. Carpenter?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Why -- the light in my room went out.  Thank you, Bobby. Goodnight.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: The skeletal structure is completely normal.  Same for the major organs -Â– heart, liver, spleen, kidneys.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: And the lungs are the same as ours. Must mean a similar atmosphere -- similar pressure.  How old do you think he is?

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Oh, I'd say forty-five.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: He told me this morning when I examined him. He's seventy-eight.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Their life expectancy is a hundred and thirty.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: How does he explain that?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: He says their medicine is that much more advanced.  He was very nice about it. But he made me feel like a third-class witch doctor.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: My name is Harley -- Secretary to the President  I've been told that you speak our language -- that your name is Mr. Klaatu.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Just Klaatu.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: The President asked me to convey his deepest apologies for what has happened. We all feel--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Sit down, Mr. Harley.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I'm sure I don't have to point out that your arrival was something of a surprise.  Had you been traveling long?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: About five months -- your months.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: You must have come a long way.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: About 250 million of your miles.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Naturally we're very curious to know where it is you come from.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: From another planet. Let's just say that we're neighbors.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: It's rather difficult for us to think of another planet as a neighbor.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm afraid, in the present situation you'll have to learn to think that way.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: The present situation?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I mean the reasons for my coming here.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: We're very curious about that, too. Would you care to talk about it?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'd be glad to.  Not now, of course -- with you alone.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Perhaps you'd rather discuss it personally with the President--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: This is not a personal matter, Mr. Harley. It concerns all the people on your planet.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I -- I'm not sure I understand--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I want to meet with representatives from all the nations of the Earth.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I'm afraid that would be a little awkward. It's -- it's completely without precedent. And there are practical considerations -- the time involved -- the enormous distances.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I traveled 250 million miles. What about your United Nations?

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: You know about the United Nations?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We've been monitoring your radio broadcasts for a good many years. That's how we learned your languages. Lately, we've been getting your television also.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: You must have a rather strange impression of us.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: The first two years of television we were convinced that all you did was wrestle.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I'm sure you recognize from our broad- casts the evil forces that have produced the tension in our world. Surely you would agree--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I am not concerned, Mr. Harley, with the internal affairs of your planet. I consider that to be your business -- not mine.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I was only hoping to make you understand.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: My mission here is not to solve your petty squabbles. It concerns the existence of every last creature who lives on Earth.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Perhaps if you could explain a little--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I intend to explain. To all the nations -- simultaneously.  How do we proceed, Mr. Harley?

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: We could call a special meeting of the General Assembly... But of course the UN doesn't represent all of the nations.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Then why not a meeting of all the Chiefs of State?

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Believe me, you don't understand. They wouldn't sit down at the same table.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I will make that recommendation to the President.  I must tell you in all honesty that I'm extremely dubious about the results.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Apparently I'm not as cynical about Earth's people as you are.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I've been dealing in Earth's politics a good deal longer than you have.  Goodnight, sir.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Good afternoon.  I'm glad to see you up and around.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Thank you... Have you any news?

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Not very good news, I'm afraid.  The President accepted your suggestion and cabled the invitations for a meeting last night.  Let me read you some of the replies.  "The Premier wishes to inform the Government of the United States that it will be impossible for him to attend the meeting suggested by the President unless the meeting is held in Moscow."  "The suggestion of the President regarding the possibility of a meeting in Moscow would be unacceptable to Her Majesty's Government at the present time. Representation could be sent only if the meeting were held in Washington."  Well -- there you have it.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I tried to make you understand. The suspicions -- the jealousies -- the mistrust--  Surely you realize that my government has done everything in its power--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It's not your government I'm thinking about. It's your world.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Now that you understand the situation more clearly, perhaps you'd like to discuss the matter with the President

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I will not speak to any one nation or group of nations.  I don't intend to add my contribution to your childish jealousies and suspicions.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Our problems are very complex, Mr. Klaatu. You mustn't judge us too harshly.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I can judge only by what I see.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Your impatience is quite understandable.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I am impatient with stupidity. My people have learned to live without it.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: I'm afraid my people haven't.  I'm very sorry -- I wish it were otherwise.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Before making any decisions, I think I should get out among your people -- become familiar with the basis for these strange, unreasoning attitudes.

turns.speaker: HARLEY
turns.text: Under the circumstances I'm afraid that will be impossible.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We're all set. I picked up some sandwiches and put gas in the car. And the radio's still busted, so me can forget about the space man for today.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: There's only one thing -- I haven't been able to arrange for anyone to stay with Bobby.  I don't suppose we could take him with us?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, we could--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: There's always somebody here, but today of course they've all got plans.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It was a wonderful day.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You still haven't answered my question.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You know how I feel, Tom. I just want to think it over.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: The boss is leaving for Chicago tomorrow. If I could tell him I was getting married -- with two dependents--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You're a good salesman -- but I've got to think about it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: A good insurance salesman wouldn't give you time to think.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Hello--

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I will be in just a minute.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: The picture starts at eight-fifty.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I was talking to Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I hope Mr. Carpenter won't think I'm intruding.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, Tom, that was awful.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm sorry. I guess I'm just tired of hearing about Mr. Carpenter.  I don't like the way he's attached himself to you and Bobby. After all, what do you know about him?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: He's not there.  But look what I found in his room

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is it real?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Looks real to me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I wonder if we ought to--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Bobby and I have had enough excitement for tonight.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You think it's all right for you to stay here?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I've got a good lock on my door.  And Bobby's going to sleep in my room tonight.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm at Bleeker's getting an appraisal on that diamond. I thought we might have lunch together.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I -- I'm afraid I can't -- not right now. Can I talk to you later?. Yes, that'll be fine. 'Bye.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tom -- I've been trying to get you all afternoon--

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Come on in.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I've got some terrific news about your friend, Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What about him?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Helen, he's the man from the space ship!  I had that diamond checked at three different places. Nobody on earth's ever seen a stone like that! After what Bobby told us, that's enough for me. Why is it nobody knows anything about him? Why hasn't he got any money?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: All right, Tom -- it's true. I know it's true.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Never mind about that.  You've got to promise me you won't say a word to anybody.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Are you crazy? After what happened today?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You don't understand. You don't realize how important it is.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Important? Of course it's important. The point is we can do something about it.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's what I'm trying to tell you. We mustn't do anything about it. Believe me, Tom, I know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: He's a menace to the whole world! It's our duty to turn him in.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: But he isn't a menace! He told me what he came here for.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: He told you... Don't be silly, honey -- just because you like the guy.  You realize what this'd mean for us? I'd be the biggest man in the country. I could write my own ticket.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is that what you're thinking about?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Why not? Somebody's got to get rid of him.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tom, you mustn't -- ! You don't know what you're doing! It isn't just you and Mr. Carpenter. The rest of the world, is involved!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I don't care about the rest of the world!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You'll feel different when you see my picture in the papers.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I feel different right now.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You wait and see. You're going to marry a big hero!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm not going to marry anybody.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know how to thank you.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I enjoyed every minute of it.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Everyone seems so--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Jittery is the word.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Bobby's the only person I know who isn't -- Jittery.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He has his homework to keep him occupied.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: He's a fine boy, Mrs. Benson.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Naturally I think so.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Warm and friendly and intelligent--  You know -- he's the only real friend I've made since I've been here.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Mr. Carpenter -- this is none of my business, but -- why did that detective come here last night?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Oh -- they just wanted to ask me a few questions. Bobby and I tried to see Professor Barnhardt in the afternoon, but he wasn't in. Apparently they thought I was looking for secrets of some kind.
